verses.verse: The wicked man does deceptive work, But (Hos. 10:12; (Gal. 6:8, 9); James 3:18) he who sows righteousness will have a sure reward.
As righteousness leads to (Prov. 10:16; 12:28) life, So he who pursues evil pursues it to his own (Prov. 21:16; (Rom. 6:23; James 1:15)) death.
Those who are of a perverse heart are an abomination to the LORD, But the blameless in their ways are His delight.
(Prov. 16:5) Though they join forces, the wicked will not go unpunished; But (Ps. 112:2; Prov. 14:26) the posterity of the righteous will be delivered.
As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout, So is a lovely woman who lacks discretion.
The desire of the righteous is only good, But the expectation of the wicked (Prov. 10:28; Rom. 2:8, 9) is wrath.
There is one who (Ps. 112:9; Prov. 13:7; 19:17) scatters, yet increases more; And there is one who withholds more than is right, But it leads to poverty.
(Prov. 3:9, 10; (2 Cor. 9:6, 7)) The generous soul will be made rich, ((Matt. 5:7)) And he who waters will also be watered himself.
The people will curse (Amos 8:5, 6) him who withholds grain, But (Job 29:13) blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
He who earnestly seeks good finds favor, (Esth. 7:10; Ps. 7:15, 16; 57:6) But trouble will come to him who seeks evil.
(Job 31:24) He who trusts in his riches will fall, But (Ps. 1:3; Jer. 17:8) the righteous will flourish like foliage.
He who troubles his own house (Eccl. 5:16) will inherit the wind, And the fool will be (Prov. 14:19) servant to the wise of heart.
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life, And (Prov. 14:25; (Dan. 12:3; 1 Cor. 9:19-22; James 5:20)) he who wins souls is wise.
(Jer. 25:29) If the righteous will be recompensed on the earth, How much more the ungodly and the sinner.
Whoever loves instruction loves knowledge, But he who hates correction is stupid.
A good man obtains favor from the LORD, But a man of wicked intentions He will condemn.
A man is not established by wickedness, But the ((Prov. 10:25)) root of the righteous cannot be moved.
(Prov. 31:23; 1 Cor. 11:7) An excellent wife is the crown of her husband, But she who causes shame is (Prov. 14:30; Hab. 3:16) like rottenness in his bones.
The thoughts of the righteous are right, But the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
(Prov. 1:11, 18) The words of the wicked are, “Lie in wait for blood,” (Prov. 14:3) But the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
(Ps. 37:35-37; Prov. 11:21; Matt. 7:24-27) The wicked are overthrown and are no more, But the house of the righteous will stand.
A man will be commended according to his wisdom, (1 Sam. 25:17; Prov. 18:3) But he who is of a perverse heart will be despised.
(Prov. 13:7) Better is the one who is slighted but has a servant, Than he who honors himself but lacks bread.
(Deut. 25:4) A righteous man regards the life of his animal, But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
(Gen. 3:19) He who tills his land will be satisfied with (Prov. 28:19) bread, But he who follows frivolity (Prov. 6:32) is devoid of understanding.
The wicked covet the catch of evil men, But the root of the righteous yields fruit.
(Prov. 18:7) The wicked is ensnared by the transgression of his lips, ((2 Pet. 2:9)) But the righteous will come through trouble.

(Prov. 13:2; 15:23; 18:20) A man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth, (Job 34:11; Prov. 1:31; 24:12; (Is. 3:10, 11); Hos. 4:9) And the recompense of a man’s hands will be rendered to him.
